This is now released: code.google.com/appengine/docs/python/channel
At this time, I would rule out doing Comet in App Engine (any language).
Comet is based on long-lived HTTP connections, and App Engine will time out any single connection in about 30 seconds or so at most; it's hard to conceive of a worse match!
I found this article which explains a sort of comet.

30 seconds is more than enough; either way you should return a no-op message when a time passed and no new events occur.
This prevents client timeouts and is done by everybody who does comet.
Just send the request, and on the server make it wait until an event or timeout after 25 seconds.
